benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Scenarios TC01-TC04 demonstrate creation with valid payloads and appropriate headers, and TC18 confirms persistence via GET.
Invalid Payload: Scenarios TC08 (malformed body), TC09 (missing body), TC11 (extra fields), and TC06 (invalid ID format) cover improper inputs.
Authorization: Scenarios TC07 (missing header) and TC12 (unauthorized access) cover authorization behavior.
Duplicate Submission: Scenario TC17 addresses handling of duplicate field names within a payload.
Large Payloads: TC14 tests maximum payload size handling.
Validation/Edge Cases: TC19-TC21 cover length, special characters, and validation boundaries; TC22-TC24 cover system state variations and degraded performance.
Concurrency: TC16 validates behavior under concurrent requests.
System Error Handling: TC13 (503 service unavailable) and TC25 (network failure recovery).
Integration/GET: TC18 verifies custom fields are retrievable after creation.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or handling burst of requests.
Internal Server Error: No explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error scenario (beyond 503).
Idempotency: No explicit test for repeated identical submissions (beyond some duplicate-field tests).
GET listing pagination: No tests for pagination when retrieving large sets of custom fields.
Caching behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on GET responses; not applicable to POST but relevant for GET.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests to verify throttling and proper error handling under load.
Add an explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario to ensure the API handles unexpected server failures gracefully.
Add an idempotency test for re-sending the same payload to verify duplicate handling in POST requests.
Add tests for GET response pagination when multiple fields exist, ensuring correct page size and navigation.
Add tests for caching headers on GET responses if applicable (ETag, Cache-Control).
Consider expanding authorization tests to include token expiry and role-based access variations.
